fpmExplorer:Page.title: Analytical Table
fpmExplorer:Page.introduction: Analytical tables enable you to display and manage your data efficiently. This table type provides powerful functionalities, including advanced grouping and aggregation.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Annotating a Service as an Analytical Service
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: To set the analytical capabilities of your service or entity, use the Aggregation.ApplySupported annotation at the entity set level. The analytical table offers the possibility to group rows based on groupable properties. You must define which properties are groupable so that the table allows grouping the relevant properties. To annotate a set of properties as groupable, add it to the GroupableProperties annotation.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Defining Aggregatable Properties
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: The properties can also be annotated as aggregatable (measures). To do so, at the entity level, you must also define the Aggregation.CustomAggregate annotation, which has the property name as the qualifier.
